Title: ECOWAS to slash air fare, eliminate taxes by January 2026
Summary: ECOWAS to slash air fare, eliminate taxes by January 2026 . Air ticket taxes across West Africa will be removed and air fares slashed by over 20 per cent . This forms part of a sweeping regional policy to make air travel affordable and strengthen economic activities .

Title: Tinubu moves to resolve outstanding payments to over 2,000 federal contractors
Summary: Tinubu has constituted a high-level ministerial committee to tackle the long-standing issue of unpaid obligations to more than 2,000 federal contractors . Special Adviser to the President on Information and Strategy, Bayo Onanuga, said the move was to resolve outstanding payments to the contractors .

Title: FIRS, France agency seal tax-administration deal as FIRS readies NRS rollout
Summary: Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) formalised a new partnership with France’s Direction Générale des Finances Publiques . The partnership is part of preparations for its transition to the Nigerian Revenue Service next month .

Title: MAAUN under pressure as anti-corruption agency queries ‘compulsory’ N750,000 graduation levy
Summary: The Maryam Abacha American University of Nigeria (MAAUN) is under intense scrutiny by the anti-corruption agency over the ‘compulsory’ N750,000 graduation levy being demanded from graduating students . The management of the private university in Kano is said to have tied the university's management .

Title: SERAP, editors warn against media repression
Summary: The Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project (SERAP), alongside the Nigeria Guild of Editors (NGE), urged President Bola Tinubu, state governors and security agencies to end what they described as the growing harassment and intimidation of journalists, activists, bloggers, bloggers .

Title: Orumba South LGA adopts zoning system for political offices
Summary: Orumba South LGA adopts zoning system for political offices . Zoning and rotation system for all elective and appointive positions .

Title: Senate passes second reading of bill to establish Chartered Institute of Planning of Nigeria
Summary: The Nigerian Senate has passed the second reading of a bill to establish the Chartered Institute of Planning of Nigeria (CIPN) The bill has been passed by the Nigerian Senate .

Title: NDLEA, vigilante group initiate nationwide push against drug abuse
Summary: Marwa was speaking at a two-day Drug Prevention, Treatment and Care (DPTC) Training and Sensitisation on Dangers of Drug Abuse organised for VGN members .

Title: Obasanjo endorses ‘Omimi Wonder Garri’ and Fish Powder to boost food security
Summary: Olusegun Obasanjo endorses 'Omimi Wonder Garri' and Fish Powder to boost food security . Former President endorses locally developed fortified garri, branded Omimi ‘Wonder Garri’ and a fish powder .

Title: FEC endorses new industrial policy, okays ₦58bn for 200 electric buses, ₦187.8bn contract for BOI
Summary: Federal Executive Council, FEC, okays ₦58bn for 200 electric buses, � 187.8bn contract for BOI . FEC also okays the procurement of electric buses and key infrastructure projects in Lagos .

Title: Reps summon Cardoso over non-remittance of ₦16tn revenue
Summary: A rowdy session broke out on the floor of the House of Representatives on Wednesday . Lawmakers disagreed over which committee should question the Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria, Olayemi Cardoso . The uproar followed the adoption of a motion titled “Non-remittance of over ₦5tn operating surplus and �

Title: Tinubu’s ambassadorial nominee struggles to name Ekiti senators
Summary: Emmanuel Adeyemi, one of President Bola Tinubu’s career nominees, stumbled over a basic question many senators considered fundamental: naming all three senators from his home state of Ekiti . He dazzled the Senate Committee on Foreign Affairs with an impressive résumé spanning Hong Kong and France, where he earned a PhD

Title: Tinubu creates panel to clear N1.5tn debts owed 2,000 contractors
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has set up a high-level committee to resolve the backlog of unpaid federal contractors and fund repayments . Special Adviser on Information and Strategy, Bayo Onanuga, said the President was “upset” after learning that about 2,000 contractors are owed .

Title: Ekiti spent N49.7bn on airport project, begins commercial flights
Summary: Ekiti State Governor, Biodun Oyebanji, on Wednesday said the state has spent N49.7bn on the Ekiti Agro-Allied International Cargo Airport . The airport project originated under former Governor Ayodele Fayose in 2019, progressed under Dr. Kayode Fayemi, who facilitated a test flight

Title: NDLEA arrests two suspected traffickers, seizes 763kg skunk cannabis in Edo
Summary: The Edo State Command of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, on Wednesday, said it arrested two traffickers and seized 763kg of skunk cannabis in the state .
